title: The Difficulty Selector
subtitle: Multiple Conditions with Elif
description:
# More Than Two Choices

Learn to handle multiple options with elif!

## The elif Statement

```gdscript
var difficulty = "medium"

if difficulty == "easy":
    var enemy_health = 50
elif difficulty == "medium":
    var enemy_health = 100
elif difficulty == "hard":
    var enemy_health = 200
else:
    var enemy_health = 100  # default
```

## Your Quest

Create a difficulty selector that sets different enemy stats based on user choice (easy/medium/hard).
starterCode:
# Difficulty Selector
var difficulty = "medium"  # Try: easy, medium, hard

var enemy_health
var enemy_damage

# Set stats based on difficulty
solutionCode:
# Difficulty Selector
var difficulty = "medium"

var enemy_health
var enemy_damage

# Set stats based on difficulty
if difficulty == "easy":
    enemy_health = 50
    enemy_damage = 5
    print("EASY MODE")
elif difficulty == "medium":
    enemy_health = 100
    enemy_damage = 15
    print("MEDIUM MODE")
elif difficulty == "hard":
    enemy_health = 200
    enemy_damage = 30
    print("HARD MODE")
else:
    enemy_health = 100
    enemy_damage = 15
    print("Invalid! Default to MEDIUM")

print("Enemy HP: ", enemy_health)
print("Enemy Damage: ", enemy_damage)
hints: Set multiple variables in each branch
